attributes.action: Keep the Personal Injury Small Claims Limit at £1,000/ Keep Damages for whiplash
attributes.background:
The MOJ has published a consultation paper proposing amongst other things:-
1. The abolish low value whiplash claims for injuries up to 6 months
2. To raise the small claims track to £5,000 for all personal injury claims.
3. To introduce the assistance of Mackenzie friends in such claims.

attributes.action: Improve safety legislation for coaches so no more children get injured
attributes.background: Two years ago our son almost died when he fell out of a faulty door on a coach at 60 mph.  It has highlighted to us that safety legislation is only applied to newer coaches and operators can hide the age of coaches behind private plates. This is a dangerous combination that needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
Improved legislation is needed.
If safety legislation is passed this should apply to all coaches, not just ones manufactured from that date.
Operators should not be able to hide the age of their coaches behind private plates and there should be a far better system of visibility and transparency over the age of the coach, the level of safety equipment it has and the licence history of the operator. Otherwise you really have no idea what kind of coach your child is getting on or how safe it is!

attributes.action:
Block or change the EASA Commission Regulation
on Unmanned Aircraft Operations
attributes.background:
The UK UAV industry is currently thriving
and is even recognised by EASA themselves “Unmanned aircraft is a sector of aviation that is developing very fast and has a great potential for producing new jobs and growth.“

 BUT With the EASA new proposed regulations all of this is under threat.
attributes.additional_details:
“Drones” and other UAV are well covered under the Civil Aviation Authority Air Navigation Order. Regarded by most as fair and accurate

EASA proposals will override this (even once we have left the EU)
And have clearly been written by people with little understand of the subject. the expected result of them is:

* Death of the related industry (not a slowdown but an outright death)

* Public disregard for all rules

*cease of UAV use for UK emergency services and other lifesaving uses

attributes.action: Allow EU citizens to remain in the UK after exit from the EU with same rights
attributes.background: EU citizens who study or work and pay taxes in the UK are a fundamental part of society. The UK would not be able to function without the taxes paid in by the EU immigrants. Their rights should also not be decreased if they've been paying in for years.

attributes.action: Grant an amnesty to all illegal immigrants living in the UK prior to 23.06.2016.
attributes.background: Following Britain's decision to leave the EU, many people fear a significant shift to the right and violence against foreign nationals living in Britain. To prevent the victimisation of illegal immigrants by right-wing radicals, they need to have the full protection of the law as British citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Illegal immigrants are already victimised in many ways, for example by being indebted to people traffickers, enslaved as sweatshop workers, and exploited as sex workers. This situation can only worsen if Britain's exit from the EU is understood as a victory for a xenophobes and racists. Granting amnesty to illegal immigrants would provide them with a way out of their current servitude and save them from the aggression of right-wing thugs.

attributes.action: STOP the cruel treatment Foxhounds constantly receive
attributes.background: Petition is asking for the govt or another source to monitor the welfare of the hounds. It is estimated that around 4,000 hounds are clubbed to death or shot each year if found unsuitable or show weakness. Week old pups are killed if not strong enough. Unsuitable or old dogs should be re-homed.
attributes.additional_details: It is seen as normal to shoot & incinerate hounds when no longer productive & disposed of if they fail in any way. They are killed at half their life expectancy, Hounds are punished for chasing the wrong scent. As soon as they are born they are taught to be savage which is not their natural instinct & removed if not savage enough. Old dogs are replaced in a constant cycle & shot without remorse & burned. More hounds are bred than needed. Some hounds are killed when hunting. They deserve better.

attributes.action: Pass law to force employers to pay on time for freelance/contractual work.
attributes.background: Too many times have we all (as freelancers) faced clients that do not pay, or take forever to do so. We have no structure or law to support us in this matter except for small claims court. Sometime larger clients can bully a sole trader/contractor into relying on their terms, rather than other.
attributes.additional_details:
Much alike the New York City Council move.. http://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/nyc-passes-law-forcing-employers-pay-freelancers-time-article-1.2847980

Freelance Isn't Free. In surveys, 70% of freelancers report either not getting paid or having to wait months for their money for jobs.

Employers and agencies often sit on the money to gain their own interest rather than pay quickly and on time. The freelance contractor has no power and has to wait because the money is valuable to them.

attributes.action: For every new teacher to learn about Speech, Language and Communication Needs
attributes.background: We are calling on the Government to include Speech, Language and Communication Needs (SLCN) as part of any initial teacher training package. All trainee teachers should learn about SLCN so that they are able to adapt their teaching strategies and fully support their students to succeed and achieve.
attributes.additional_details: In English Schools 20.9% of all children on Special Educational Needs (SEN) support & 14% of children that have an Education, Health and Care Plan (EHCP) have SLCN (DfE Schools, pupils and their characteristics: January 2016). Language Impairment is seven times more common than other developmental conditions such as autism (SCALES study 2016). Including SLCN on any initial teacher training package would raise awareness & allow new teachers to feel more confident at identifying these children.

attributes.action: NHS pensions for ALL Dental Care Professionals who work in NHS Dental Practices.
attributes.background: Dental Care Professionals working in General Dental Practices with an NHS contract, providing NHS care are not entitled to an NHS pension and the full benefits of providing NHS care to patients. Working under or alongside NHS Dental practice owners or associate dentists who are entitled to this.
attributes.additional_details: All members of the Dental Team whether that be a Dental Nurse working along side an NHS dentist, Dental Therapists and Hygienists who work under a Dentist or associates prescription, or the Practice Managers and reception/admin staff ALL contribute to an NHS contract and the NHS care provided to patients.

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to approve nivolumab to treat advanced Kidney Cancer
attributes.background: Nivolumab has shown great promise in the treatment of kidney cancer. Following the 1st meeting to review the clinical trial evidence & cost-effectiveness of Nivolumab in treating kidney cancer, NICE has said it's unlikely they'll recommend the drug for this area. This stance needs reversing.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, more than 11,800 people were diagnosed with kidney cancer; that's about 33 people each day.  It is now the seventh most common cancer in the UK:  the fifth most common cancer in men and the tenth in women.  Since the late 1970s, kidney cancer incidence rates have more than doubled in Great Britain. With rising numbers each year, Nivolumab could make a huge difference to many people's lives.
attributes.creator_name: Malcolm Packer on behalf of Kidney Cancer UK

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the Prison System
attributes.background:
Our Prison System is in crisis - experts accurately describe it as in 'meltdown'. 
A plethora of independent HMI Prison inspection reports has consistently supported this view. 
Yesterday prison officers raised anguished voices, outside our prisons in guttural cries of despair. 
Enough is enough.
attributes.additional_details: Our Prison System has no direction, funding, or vision for delivery. Prison staff are daily facing drugs, drones, suicides, self-harm, murders, escapes from closed conditions, and vicious physical assaults from drug-induced prisoners now running at 65 assaults a day, every day. Enough is enough. Independent HMI Prison inspection  reports deliver evidence weekly of decay and collapse. We need an independent inquiry into the future of the Prison  Service, it's mission, conditions and resources.

attributes.action: Establish a commission to limit the mandate of the Bank of England and end QE.
attributes.background: Quantitative Easing (QE) attempts to create economic growth by unconventional, unproven methods. QE has been accompanied by unprecedentedly lower interest rates on savings accounts and Government bonds.These low interest rates threaten the real wealth of British savers, investors and pensioners.

attributes.action: Create an independent authority to fact-check political campaign materials.
attributes.background: There is a clear indication that misinformation was spread throughout both EU Referendum campaigns. We the undersigned, urge the government to create an independent authority to fact-check and monitor the legal standard of information for all official political campaign materials in future votes.
attributes.additional_details: In 1998, the Neill Committee recommended political parties should establish a code of best practice in partnership with the advertising industry. In 2003, the Electoral Commission concluded the Advertising Standards Authority should not be responsible for regulating election advertising, but the Commission did not establish a separate Code. This remains the case today. (ASA Political Advertising 21 July 2014).

attributes.action: Make teacher training on ADHD compulsory in schools
attributes.background: So many parents are fighting to get a diagnoses for their child and when they finally get a Adhd diagnoses schools don't know how to manage it or simply dont believe it. Schools need more training. Stop labelling our children naughty and learn about the condition. Adhd is more complex! Make a change

attributes.action: Properly fund the NHS and scrap the proposed STP programme.
attributes.background: The UK spends less on health as a share of its GDP than most other G7 countries. Our NHS is under pressure as never before and is in danger of failure. The NHS is effectively only getting an increase of 0.95% per year. The STP programme will close A&E's and essential services across the country.
attributes.additional_details:
Spending on health compared to other countries:
http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-compared

Effective increase of 0.95% per year for the NHS:
http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/nhs-budget

Draft sustainability and transformation plans (STPs) which propose ward closures, cuts in bed numbers and changes to A&E and GP care in 44 areas:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-37186455

attributes.action: Change the DLA guide to reflect the needs of children with heart conditions.
attributes.background: 12 children each day in the UK are born with heart defects, others acquire them due to viruses. Outcomes for these children have never been better with surgical advances, but they need supervision, care and medication to allow them to live longer lives.  Many also have mobility needs.
attributes.additional_details: DLA is a benefit for children with disabilities.   Decision Makers have a guide which they use to make awards.  However because heart conditions do not appear in this guide even though they were in the old 'adult' version, Decision Makers have no guidance as to what awards to give.  Because of this, often they will make no award at all.  Sometimes they make awards that don't truly reflect the needs of the child and will only make them for short periods of time when these conditions are for life.

attributes.action: Enhance democracy by ending corporate domination of the media
attributes.background: A plural and diverse media is an essential part of a healthy democracy and yet in the UK three companies control 71% of national newspaper circulation and five companies control 81% of local newspaper titles. We demand a debate on how to end corporate media domination  and how to enhance pluralism.
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned demand an end to the domination of our media by a small number of individuals. The EU referendum demonstrated the dismal state of our democracy. Journalist Anthony Hilton asked Rupert Murdoch why he was so opposed to the European Union. 'That’s easy,' he replied. 'When I go into Downing Street they do what I say; when I go to Brussels they take no notice.' We deserve a more democratic system than this and we should set about creating one immediately.

attributes.action: Order a public enquiry into the PCSE Contract, and its impact on NHS services.
attributes.background: The Primary Care Support England contract was awarded to Capita by NHS England and commenced in March 2016. The service has lost countless medical records, placed services in jeopardy, and resulted in delays to junior doctors being able to start in their posts.

attributes.action: CONDEMN Art 25(b) of Indian Constitution Which Violates Sikhs' Religious Freedom
attributes.background:
Sikhs were recognized by the Britain as privy to Indian Independence Act, 1947, on the basis of their separate religious identity.
Today, UK is home to over 800,000 Sikhs who have excelled in every walk of life.
On Jan 26 1950, India promulgated constitution abolishing separate status of Sikhism.
attributes.additional_details:
Art 25(b) of Indian Constitution labels Sikhs as Hindus and forces the Sikh community to follow HINDU Marriage Act; Succession Act; Minority and Guardianship Act;  Adoption and Maintenance Act.

With over 30 million followers, Sikhism is recognized as separate religion throughout the world, except in India.

We urge the UK Government to:

"CONDEMN Article 25(b) of the Indian Constitution which violates religious freedom and identity of Sikhs by labeling them as Hindus".

attributes.action: End Legal Aid for failed Asylum seekers and foriegn criminals
attributes.background: They are costing the country million each year and the only one who benefit are the legal profession

attributes.action: Urge India to stop killing Kashmiris& resolve it by holding impartial plebiscite
attributes.background: More than 68,000 people have been killed in the uprising and the subsequent Indian military crackdown in Indian administered Kashmir. In the current wave of unrest since 08/07/16 more then 20 protestors have died and more then 200 injured by the crakdown of Indian forces including army and police.
attributes.additional_details: The dispute of Kashmir started after the departure of British rule from the region and leaving the state of Kashmir to decide its fate. The Maharaja of Kashmir decided to merge with India against people's wishes. People's demand is a plebiscite to decide their own fate, which India has been denying. There is over 200,000 thousand Indian armed forces besides police and other security personnel to keep a tight control on the region by might. More than 68,000 people have been killed in the uprising since and the subsequent Indian military crackdown in Indian administered Kashmir. In the current wave of unrest as of 08/07/16 some 20 protestors have died and more then 200 injured by the crakdown of Indian forces including army and police.

attributes.action: Grant section 30 order to devolve powers for a 2nd Referendum.
attributes.background: The UK has voted to leave the EU against the overwhelming wish of the Scottish People. We now demand a section 30 order from the UK Government to hold a second referendum as a result of this substantial change in circumstance.
attributes.additional_details: To hold a referendum, a section 30 order is required to devolve the necessary powers for that referendum. We want the UK Government to agree to one immediately. If they do not then the referendum will proceed under a plebiscite.

attributes.action: Protect the A&E and Women & Children's Unit at Telford's Princess Royal Hospital
attributes.background:
Future Fit ('FF') was tasked with improving care in the Telford and Shrewsbury Hospitals.

FF's proposals include closing one of the two current A&E units and possibly moving Women and Children's ('WC') services, despite investment in a dedicated £28 million facility in Telford just two years ago.
attributes.additional_details:
Both Telford and Shropshire have growing populations and accommodate different geographical locations; both current A&E units struggle - local healthcare needs expanding not retracting. Reducing to one A&E will cause unnecessary strain, and ultimately, deaths.

In 2014 the Health Secretary promised that “we commit to A&E on both sites and there are no plans to change that”. Mr Hunt is called upon to ensure that commitment is kept.

Moving WC services would be a waste of a £28 million investment.

attributes.action: Make 'Nutritionist' a legally protected title
attributes.background: Currently, due to lack of regulation, anyone can set up and practice as a nutritionist/nutritional therapist, meaning there is no real protection for consumers. The Government should take action to prevent unqualified people from potentially putting people’s health at risk.
attributes.additional_details: There is very little understanding about what a ‘Registered Nutritionist’ is and how it compares to a nutritional therapist, nutritionist, nutrition advisor (the list of terms goes on). Yes, we have a UK voluntary register of Nutritionists held by the Association for Nutrition but this goes (mostly) unnoticed by the media and the public. It’s vital that we increase the awareness of this register so that people understand where to go to for accurate, evidence based advice.

attributes.action: Public inquiry into misleading claims and pledges made during the EU referendum.
attributes.background:
We the undersigned call upon HM government to perform an inquiry into the pledges and claims made during the EU referendum campaign that were intended to deceive the British public. 

Misrepresenting the truth to get the British public to vote one way or another is an abuse of democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Statistics Authority told the Leave campaign the £350 million a week figure was misleading, Leave continued to use the figure. 

The Leave campaign stated that the level of immigration is putting pressure on the NHS. Since the result a Leave MP has said that the Leave campaign wish to "control" immigration, not necessarily reduce it. 

UKIP used an image on a poster showing migrants crossing the Croatia-Slovenia border, with the phrase "breaking point" to imply they were entering Britain.

attributes.action: Make Homosexual Conversion/Reparative Therapy Illegal
attributes.background: Conversion or Reparative Therapy is the belief that through psychological intervention a person may be able to reject their own same sex attraction and become 'heterosexual'.This destructive and prejudiced rhetoric must be condemned as it's consequences for patients are detrimental to say the least.
attributes.additional_details: As found by the American Psychological Association, people that have gone through conversion therapy are 3 times more likely to use illegal drugs, be 8.9 times more likely to be subject to suicidal thoughts and face depression at 5.9 times the rate of their peers. As discovered by  Stonewall, out of 1300 mental health professionals, more than 200 had offered some form of this therapy, with 40% of treatments happening within the NHS. Some patients are even subjected to electroconvulsive therapy.

attributes.action: We want an urgent improvement in Mental Health Care in this country!
attributes.background: My 22 year old son died this year. He suffered from depression. He was denied counselling and instead was prescribed medication. He turned to drugs just before his death to help him through these dark times and I truly believe, that had he been offered urgent counselling, he would not have done so.

attributes.action: Chicken Pox vaccination part of the NHS programme.
attributes.background: Chicken pox is considered a common childhood illness, Sadly it can cause unnecessary pain and suffering to many. And some have severe complications like my 2 year old son who has to be admitted to hospital after getting a severe infection in his chicken pox.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition to help give parents and children the choice to have this vaccination on the NHS. My son is a healthy 2 year old and should not have had any complications. No other child should have to go through this. Make the change today for the health and future of our children.

attributes.action: To stop/prevent a second referendum on Scottish independence.
attributes.background: As a result of the outcome of the EU referendum it has created a cocktail of uncertainty. Political stability will decrease the economic consequences. If a second referendum on Scottish independence is on the table, it will create more uncertainty and result in complete economic turmoil.

attributes.action: Change the colour of all newly issued passports back to blue.
attributes.background: Now that the United Kingdom is leaving the European Union, it would be good to move back to the original 'old blue' colour for the cover, which was replaced by burgundy in the period 1988-93.

attributes.action: Restore the Department of Energy and Climate Change
attributes.background: With climate change being placed under the new 'Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy', it shows us that the PM does not take the issue seriously, although its effects are already showing. Protecting the planet is a huge job, that deserves it's own department.
attributes.additional_details: Numerous floods across the UK in such a short space of time, with three occurring in one month, show the disastrous effects of climate change on people and the environment. People could not leave their homes, homes and buildings were flooded out and many citizens suffered. Without proper care and protection, many more will follow.

attributes.action: On BREXIT British expatriates should retain their healthcare within the EU
attributes.background: As part of the Brexit negotiations the UK Government should ensure that British expatriates who were residents of other EU countries at the time of the Referendum vote, should retain their rights to healthcare in their countries of residency.
attributes.additional_details:
Many British expatriates living in the EU are elderly, in need of regular healthcare and living on a fixed income. 
If they lose the right to use the health system within the countries in which they are domiciled they will inevitably either have to take out expensive health insurance that they can ill afford or return to the UK for treatment, adding further pressure on an already overburdened NHS.
Expats who were residents of other EU nations at the time of the Referendum should retain their right to healthcare in those countries.

attributes.action: Call on Government to commission an independent technical review of HS2
attributes.background:
HS2 cannot meet its stated objective of delivering “..hugely enhanced capacity and connectivity between our major conurbations”. 

We call on HM Government to commission an independent technical review of every aspect of the HS2 scheme to determine how and why this failure has happened.
attributes.additional_details: HS2 is an ill-conceived and fundamentally flawed design for a high speed rail line linking London, Birmingham, Leeds and Manchester. Originally costed at £30 billion, it is now estimated to cost £56 billion or more. The project is highly controversial because of HS2 Ltd’s failure to evaluate cheaper & better alternatives, its exorbitant cost, insufficient new capacity, poor connectivity, demolition of 500+ homes, serious damage to the Chilterns AONB & Ancient Woodlands and failure to reduce CO2

attributes.action: Change of law regarding leaving dogs in hot cars
attributes.background:
Change UK laws regarding leaving dogs in hot cars

Dogs can die within 20 minutes of being left in a car on a hot day. 

It should be an automatic criminal offence of animal cruelty for people who are caught doing this and bans from keeping dogs. 

Zero tolerance is the only way forward.
attributes.additional_details:
- Make it illegal and an offence to leave a dog in a hot car

- Compulsory prosecution Under Section 9 of the Animal Welfare Act of 2006 when a dog is rescued from a hot car

- Amend Section 5(2)(a) of the Criminal Damage Act 1971  so you will not be prosecuted for breaking a car window to rescue a dog from a hot car

attributes.action: Please provide Hampshire Police with funding to find Damien Nettles remains
attributes.background: Damien Nettles aged 16 went missing 20 years ago in Cowes, Isle of Wight. His case remains a missing person despite a presumption of murder. Hampshire Police do not have the resources or funding to elevate this case. His family are desperate for justice and closure to move on. Thank you in advance.
attributes.additional_details:
As the Government provided extra funding for the McCann's & Needham's, we feel Damien's case should have the same level of intervention.

Damien's story was recently featured in an 8 part documentary on BBC3 a Unsolved: The Boy Who Disappeared. Please see the link below for full details:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p041fkdp

attributes.action: Reinstate the maternity and children's ward at the Alexandra hospital Redditch
attributes.background: My first 2 children was born a the Alexandra hospital Redditch and when my 2 daughters had several seizures the paramedics,consultants and ward staff was exceptional and these services are being stripped away one by one and with the population of Redditch getting bigger it really isn't a good idea
attributes.additional_details: I don't know what I or other families will do when we have to travel so far and we don't have transport to get there but the main concern is the risk to children's lives because of this bad decision to close the maternity,childrens ward does a child have to loose there life for something to be done I hope not

attributes.action: Northern Ireland Border Poll for United Ireland in the EU in response to Brexit
attributes.background: The majority of people in northern ireland voted to remain in Europe during the "brexit" referendum.  Northern Ireland's decision has been discounted.  It is our democratic right to decide the future of our Island through a poll on whether to unite the Ireland and remain in the EU.
attributes.additional_details: The UK no longer has the best interests of the people of Northern Ireland in its heart. The willingness of the English people to leave the European Union goes against the wishes of the Northern Irish population therefore it is time to reevaluate our relationship and union with the United Kingdom. It is time to turn to our own island and its population, north and south of the border, to plan for a future out of the United Kingdom and in the EU, to forge a new future for the people of Ireland.

attributes.action: Fund Research into Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background: EDS is a debilitating and often life threatening conditions, there is very little research and we are a long way off a cure, we need research.

attributes.action: Prevent the closure of oak ward at Banbury Horton general hospital
attributes.background: Banbury is one of the largest towns in Oxfordshire and getting bigger and now they want to close another ward in the local hospital sending all the patients that use the ward to have treatment at the Jr Oxford

attributes.action: Overturn the decision to sell off Preston's historic Fulwood Barracks.
attributes.background: The decision to announce the end of the home of the Duke of Lancaster's regiment as part of the biggest sell-offs of military land any Government has ever announced has been met with shock, surprise and anger by the people of Lancashire.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.lep.co.uk/your-lancashire/preston/fulwood-barracks-to-close-in-shock-mod-move-1-8224299
The Grade II listed building has been home of the Queen's Lancashire Regiment for nearly 150 years and now houses four Infantry battalions. It also houses the popular Lancashire Infantry Museum, the largest Regimental archive in the north of England.
The Barracks is an important part of the history and culture of Preston and it is a vital link between the local regiment and the population.

attributes.action: Maintain Pension increases for British pensioners living in the EU.
attributes.background: Depending on what treaties are agreed for Britain's exit from the EU, some British pensioners living in the EU may lose their annual State pension increases. We call upon the Government of the United Kingdom to commit to maintaining these increases for all British pensioners living in the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Annual State Pension for British pensioners living overseas are only paid in 16 countries outside of the EU and Britain has not signed any new treaties for this since 1981.  When Britain exits the EU, the mechanism that allows pension increases to be paid there will also cease.  For this reason, we call upon the Government of the United Kingdom to ensure that when the UK leaves the EU, appropriate provision is made with the European Union to allow the payment of these increases.

attributes.action: Repeal SI 138 and allow exempted dogs who pose no danger, to live with keepers.
attributes.background: Repeal SI 138 and allow courts to add a suitable keeper at any point for any reason.  SI 138 does not protect the public - it kills dogs for the sake of killing dogs.
attributes.additional_details: If deemed to be of "type" a dog must pose no danger to be exempted. The courts assess the owner and/or keeper to ensure they are a fit and proper person. They ensure premises are secure. Defra brought in SI 138 stating  a dog that cannot live with its registered owner/keeper must be destroyed unless that owner/keeper dies or is seriously ill. This means friendly dogs who have people who are suitable to care for them  must die. This is not protecting the public. Reopen Keepership and repeal SI 138

attributes.action: We want a points-based immigration system similar to Australia
attributes.background: This is your chance to make a change. We just want a means of regulating immigration to the United Kingdom. We are 'not racist' we need control. We need 1,000,000 signatures to stop this open boarders system and crazy immigration that is destroying Great Britain.
attributes.additional_details: 1. A failure to curb migration is corrosive of public trust in politics. 2. Voters had been promised that annual net immigration could be cut to the tens of thousands. 3. Net migration to Britain reached 333,000 in 2015, the second-highest level for a year since records began in 1975. We need your help.

attributes.action: Stop disabled parking space abuse in the UK, regardless of location or ownership
attributes.background: Many with disabilities struggle just getting in & out of a parked car, disabled bays are essential. It should be illegal for any non blue badge holder to park their car in a space reserved for those with disabilities. Without this 'The Equality Act 2010' is no longer effective.
attributes.additional_details:
Abuse of disabled parking bays is *rife all over the UK. Vehicles, skips, storage, smoking areas, temporary buildings, cancer screening/blood donor vehicles, temporary displays and more appear all too often in these bays, stopping those who NEED them from using them. Emergency Service Vehicles should ALSO have their own separate parking bay(s) to stop abuse of the disabled parking facilities - a disabled person cannot undo their disability. 

*Ref: www.facebook.com/wantmyspacetakemydisability

attributes.action: Refuse entry to the refugees currently held up in Calais camps when they close
attributes.background:
There are currently over 5000 refugees camping at Calais. Natacha Bouchart plans to demolish these camps and send these people to the UK. She says this will happen "very soon". 
Our country is not capable of such numbers nor are we a soft touch.
This is not our problem.
attributes.additional_details:
Read the story here about the impending demolishing of the camps. 
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/calais-mayor-says-brexit-means-8408236?utm_content=buffercbf60&utm_medium=social&utm_source=facebook.com&utm_campaign=buffer

attributes.action: Stop the Closure of Minor Injuries Units in Ely, Doddington and Wisbech
attributes.background: Cambridgeshire & Peterborough Clinical Commissioning Group want to close our essential minor injuries units and we, the undersigned, are petitioning the government to keep these invaluable units open in areas where they are needed the most

attributes.action: NHS England: Fund second stem cell transplants for patients with blood cancer
attributes.background: In July 2016, NHS England announced that it is no longer routinely funding second transplants for patients with blood cancers and disorders. The judgement comes despite a group of experts, including clinicians and patients, recommending second transplants are funded.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many people alive today who are able to lead fulfilling and active lives because they had a second transplant. The advice of the clinical community has been ignored, effectively handing most of these patients a death sentence.

Anthony Nolan shared the story of Emily, who needed a second transplant: ‘I want to know why the NHS thought my life wasn’t worth fighting for. This could save my life, there was still hope - why didn’t they feel it was necessary to try everything possible?'

attributes.action: Exempt under 18's from paying adult fares on public transport
attributes.background:
As a 17 year old user of public transport, I find it unfair that I have should have to pay adult fares when I am not considered an adult in any other part of society eg.I can't vote, earn the minimum adult wage or buy alcohol. 
Please support my campaign for reduced fares for under 18's

attributes.action: Remove the Ban on agency fees and set a cap for fees instead.
attributes.background: It is unfair for small businesses to survive especially after the increase in online estate agency and banning the agency fee makes it more difficult for estate agency to survive. To meet costs banned fee would be forwarded to landlords who would pass the cost onto tenants by increasing their rents.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems unfair for agents to charge tenants fee however Estate agents has to pay fees for referencing, Staff for viewings, Company cars, membership of professional bodies to regulated Fair trade, subscription for property portals and etc.These are paid for providing a professional first class service to the landlord and tenants.
To cover these costs agents should be allowed to charge agency fees. A cap should be set for agency fees instead so it would be fair for the tenants and Agents.

attributes.action: Discuss a northern bypass to improve traffic flow at Chichester, West Sussex.
attributes.background: The A27 is a major road connecting the towns and cities of the South Coast. At Chichester the A27 is a dual carriageway to the south which frequently becomes gridlocked. A northern bypass proposal, popular with residents, has been dropped and voting is only on the inferior southern options.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see option details and maps at

Please take note of the costs, the saving on journey times, environmental impact and the time taken to build the "improvements" with the subsequent traffic congestion.
